metadata.Title: CVE-2018-7640 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in CImg v.220. A heap-based buffer over-read in load_bmp in CImg.h occurs when loading a crafted bmp image, a different vulnerability than CVE-2018-7588. This is in a Monochrome case, aka case 1.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-7640` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

cimg-examples - 2.4.5+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cimg package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.4.5+dfsg-1').
